intro: Helianthemum viscarium f. psilosepalum, commonly known as the narrow-sepal stonecress, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that produces small, white or pink flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and succulent, fleshy leaves. It typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh environmental conditions.
